brief_summary.textblock:
Agreement of CNAP pressure with invasive pressure is evaluated dependent on hemodynamic
      variables achieved by a PICCO monitor.

      Hypothesis: Low cardiac output and volume status but not high vascular resistance affect the
      accuracy of CNAP.

clinical_study.brief_title: CNAP Accuracy Dependent on Hemodynamic Variables
clinical_study.condition: Accuracy and Precision of Noninvasive Measurement

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  need for invasive blood pressure measurement

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  age under 18

          -  emergencies

          -  cardiac dysrhythmia

study_pop.textblock: Patients undergoing major surgery under general anaesthesia

facility.name: University Hospital, Schleswig-Holstein. Departement of Anaesthesia and Intensive Care Medicine

clinical_study.official_title: Accuracy of Continuous Non-invasive Arterial Pressure (CNAP) With Invasive Measurements Dependent on Cardiac Function, Vascular Resistance and Volume Status

overall_official.affiliation: University Hospital, Schleswig-Holstein. Departement of Anaesthesia and Intensive Care Medicine
University Hospital, Schleswig-Holstein. Departement of Anaesthesia and Intensive Care Medicine

primary_outcome.description: Accuracy and precision of CNAP in comparison with the gold standard

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case-Only, Time Perspective: Prospective
